column1: == Climate ==
Viña del Mar has a warm-summer Mediterranean climate influenced on the coast by the Humboldt Current. As in any Mediterranean climate
column2: the city experiences a dry
column3: warm summer but temperatures rarely exceed 30 °C (86 °F) due to the influence of the maritime current offshore. Summer nights are cool with temperatures around 16 °C (61 °F). Winters are damp and cool with daily high temperatures ranging from 13 to 17 °C (55 to 63 °F) and from 5 to 9 °C (41 to 48 °F) at night
column4: rarely falling below freezing. Spring and autumn can vary from mild to cool. The rain falls mainly in autumn and winter
column5: with July being the rainiest (107 mm).  The average annual rainfall totals 480 mm.
